did.abstract: One 1894 letter from E. Sterling, writing from the Mansion House in Brooklyn Heights, to a man named Theodore, whose surname is not specified, outlining Sterling's request to borrow money to purchase land in Florida.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Letter from E. Sterling, writing from the Mansion House in Brooklyn Heights, to a man named Theodore, whose surname is not specified. The letter outlines Sterling's request to borrow money to purchase land in Florida, and dates from 1894. It is on letterhead that includes an illustration of Mansion House, a hotel on Hicks Street between Clark and Pierrepont.
